question: 関わる
userExplanation: verbs ending on <ja>わる</ja> are usually intransitive
sourceMnemonic: You know that the kanji means <kanji>related</kanji>. As a verb, this often means <vocabulary>to be involved</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to be related</vocabulary>, and <vocabulary>to be connected</vocabulary>. Basically, things that have to do with being related to something else.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
Since this word consists of a kanji with hiragana attached, you can bet that it will use the kun'yomi reading. You didn't learn that reading with this kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:  

Ever heard of the "<reading>Kaw Kaw</reading> (<ja>かか</ja>) Crow Gang"? They are bad news, always eating from garbage and squawking "kaw kaw" ... You don't want <vocabulary>to be involved</vocabulary> with them.
